lexUnit.name: sneak.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move, go, or convey in a furtive or stealthy manner

sentence.text: She was about to sneak inside , when a nurse appeared .
Mr Welt sneaked about at night and removed all the wooden furniture in the school and replaced it with metal furniture .
He 's always sneaking around , just where you least expect to find him . "
Eventually she 'd slept , one arm round Anna to make sure she did n't sneak away , though the child had tried to struggle out of her grasp .
I know some of the others sneak away and do some coke , but none of them are stupid enough to get into heroin .
Mary was taking advantage of the diversion to sneak away toward her room .
These perfumed transvestites draw away rival males and sneak back to mate with the females .
` So , you were parked here illegally , " he insisted without a flicker , ` and I caught you trying to sneak back out again , after having inflicted considerable damage to my car .
I went back into the house and , when I was sure no adults had sneaked back in to spy on me , I went upstairs to my bedroom and started to pack .
` We were staying in a hotel in Maidstone and we went back for a meal , then later , about tennish , we sneaked back to see if there was anything going down .
Perhaps romance had snuck back into vogue , she thought , along with the new sexual caution .
She stops , too upset to carry on , and sneaks back into one of the ground-floor apartments to wash and put on her pyjamas for bed .
She asked Monica to stay where she was , sneaked back into the house as though she were guilty of something , came out again with the letter she had written to her mother .
" Perhaps I should have let that precious mother of yours catch you sneaking back into the house . "
Sometimes I imagined that he 'd sneaked back into the country and was leading another life .
He never knew what these special things were and tried to find out by sneaking down there at night , but the shed door was always locked .
Occasionally I 'd find an excuse to stay with my Mom and would sneak down to watch the proceedings through any available spy-hole .
She clung to the belief that Friend had sneaked down the wires through Karel 's network and one day he would come to rescue her … .
He had his back to me , so I just sneaked in and hid down by the side of the dresser .
I do n't think they leave a window open for anyone to sneak in , " said Masklin .
Once he confessed that he used to sneak in and watch his mother dressing .
Above all we should resist it because it is really intended to allow legalised Euthanasia to sneak in by the kitchen window having been refused entry at the front door .
Edouard had sneaked in behind his back .
So off we went out and we played our football , and I came back , and we were sneaking in through the back door and bumped right into him .
He would put away the car quietly , leaving the garage open in case the thud of the door woke her , then sneak in like a thief at the back door .
Again she felt overwhelmed with fatigue , but sly , lecherous images slunk into her mind , like a guilty dog sneaking in after a roll in something bad .
As I got out I caught the enigmatic Mr Goodson sneaking in through the front door , but if he 'd seen me pull up , he did n't wait to say Hello .
They do n't want anyone sneaking off and getting the shot of the decade . "
The following year , in May , I sneaked off to audition for Tiller without my mother 's knowledge .
He usually sneaked off to the lavatory and relieved himself by peeing and thinking of funerals .
But I still could n't bear to see him sneaking off with someone else .
What Peg did was to take a bed-sheet from home and sneak off with it .
Occasionally he sneaked off to one side and had a good long suck at a silver flask .
` This hunger-striking buffoon sneaks out to eat so he can be well fed when he takes over the presidency , but he is screwed , " General Noriega said of his opponent .
She must have gone to bed some time ago , else Jessie would n't have been able to sneak out .
While Vernon and Lily were serving breakfast she sneaked out and hid the crucifix behind a pile of Mr Harcourt 's empty cardboard boxes in the backyard .
Both he and Ted McMinn were fined by the club after breaking a New Year curfew by sneaking out to a late-night disco the night before a crunch match against Celtic .
Blonde Angel sneaked out after her dad went on an early fishing trip and left the door unlocked at their home in Sheffield .
The eyes of the Modigliani seemed to glare at me severely , so I sneaked out under the colonnade , where a minute later Conchis joined me .
Although he was forbidden to get out of bed he sneaked over every evening and peeped out , unable to resist looking .
My best bet would probably be to fly into one of the neighbouring states and sneak over the border at night .
If you 're going to sneak round the place whenever it suits you , I 'd rather be back in the hotel .
I sneaked round the front , thankful for the thick hedge .
Father would not know what integrity was if it sneaked up and bit his backside .
Never give him a chance to fight on even terms if you can sneak up and kill him first .
They were trying to sneak up and gain entry without being seen by the shapechanger .
While we fight the Devil on the theological front , he sneaks up on us from behind .
I imagine it would be virtually impossible to sneak up on an owl .
No foe should ever sneak up on an exhausted Marine slumbering during prolonged combat .
The next day I had just managed to sneak home and hide when Death arrived .
` It was a lad that sneaked on board .
Sneaking across the kitchen she made herself some bread and margarine .
` You think I should keep two establishments and sneak furtively from one to the other like some sort of guilty adulterous cad ? "

If the accused helps himself to services , for example , by sneaking into a cinema when no one is looking , there is no obtaining by deception .

Often she crept out of her bed in the dead of night and sneaked into the new school hall to practise .
Now , why did you sneak into the village in such an underhand manner , instead of asking our permission ? "
However , the accused who sneaks out of a cinema which he has sneaked in to is not guilty : no service has been " done " .

Back home Stevens sneaked out of the office , to visit the local business library .
` Yesterday morning , during break , you sneaked like a serpent into the kitchen and stole a slice of my private chocolate cake from my tea-tray !
There was a time when a priest had to sneak like a thief through the back streets and alleyways of this city in order to say Mass in some garret or other .
People should remember that you need attention too , and not ignore you and sneak away from you , People who sneak away from you can not really be your friends in the first place .
They would need to get one of those small cigarette boats to sneak past the coastguard .
However you build your henhouse they 'll sneak through a crack .
She closed her door quietly , regretting not leaving the Polo on the road , and tried to sneak through the back way to her room .
A few minutes later , Miranda sneaked to Adam 's bedroom .
Endill and Mould sneaked to the workshop and without any problems pushed the catapult base through the corridors and onto the grass outside .
Usually someone sneaking towards an artistic niche does so in a sideways , disguised fashion , and under cover of darkness , like a smuggler .
I sneaked up the stairs to Flat 3 , tiptoeing by the door of No. 2 so as not to disturb Lisabeth and Fenella , the two dragons who inhabited that particular dungeon .

On the return train journey to Sunderland , they were told that a group of journalists were waiting at Sunderland station , forcing the two players to decamp at Durham and sneak home via the back door .
